Description: Sherd (base). With body of bird and inscription. Made of cobalt-black painted and green glazed, crackled pottery (buff).
Curator's comments: On pottery with this signature: Y. Kanda, "Revisiting the So-called Ghaybī Workshop: Toward a History of Burjī Mamluk Ceramics", Orient 52 (2017) 39-57
Bibliographic references: Hobson 1932b / A Guide to the Islamic Pottery of the Near East (pl.xxxix.f)
Wallis 1891 / Persian Ceramic Art Belonging to Mr F DuCane Godman, FRS: The Thirteenth Century Lustred Vases (Appendix pl.vii.7)
